Study the influence of a transformation defined by \\( f(z) = e^{Qt}z \\), where \\( Q \\) is a complex matrix.

If a new function \\( g(z) = e^{Rt}z \\) (where \\( R \\) is another constant complex matrix) is applied at a specific time \\( t_1 \\) as an intervention, will the final state \\( z(T) \\) for T > t_1 still depend solely on \\( P \\) and not on \\( Q \\) or \\( R \\)?
Explanation: The intermediate application of \\( g(z) \\) shifts the trajectory of \\( z \\) again and makes the resulting state \\( z(T) \\) dependent on all three parameters: \\( P \\), \\( Q \\), and \\( R \\.
